body:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
No conflicts as of last run.

Are there travis tests which can proof it? Like your fork?
But I generally like this idea as the current situation with tuxes on the side is a bit confusing
Should this be `3.5.6` to match our [minimum supported Python](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/.python-version)?
diff_hunk:
@@ -225,3 +225,25 @@ jobs:
         RUN_FUNCTIONAL_TESTS=false
         GOAL="deploy"
         BITCOIN_CONFIG="--enable-gui --enable-reduce-exports --enable-werror"
+
+  - stage: test
+    name: 'macOS 10.10 native'
+    os: osx
+    # Use the most recent version:
+    # Xcode 11, macOS 10.14, JDK 12.0.1
+    # https://docs.travis-ci.com/user/reference/osx/#OS-X-Version
+    osx_image: xcode11
+    language:
+      - ruby
+      - python
+    python:
+        - "3.6.5"

body: Concept ACK. Will take a look at the base PR first.
Travis is ignoring this PR and my branch atm.
Can you enable travis for your forked repository?
@emilengler I tried that, but it wasn't building there either. I'll wait until the previous PR is merged and then try again.
@Sjors Ok I will fork your repository, then remove it from the parent and try to enable travis then
<!--cf906140f33d8803c4a75a2196329ecb-->Needs rebase

@Sjors Doesn't work, take a look [https://travis-ci.org/emilengler/bitcoin-sjors-test/requests](here).
I also forked your [repo](https://github.com/emilengler/bitcoin-sjors-test) here as a playgroud, I also invited you for commit access, will delete it once it is done.
<!--cf906140f33d8803c4a75a2196329ecb-->Needs rebase
why is this changed?
diff_hunk:
@@ -7,7 +7,7 @@
 export LC_ALL=C.UTF-8
 
 export HOST=x86_64-apple-darwin14
-export PACKAGES="cmake imagemagick libcap-dev librsvg2-bin libz-dev libbz2-dev libtiff-tools python3-dev python3-setuptools"
+export BREW_PACKAGES="automake berkeley-db4 libtool boost miniupnpc openssl pkg-config protobuf qt qrencode librsvg pyenv"

body:
```suggestion
    ${CI_RETRY_EXE} brew install $PACKAGES
```
diff_hunk:
@@ -4,6 +4,11 @@
 # Distributed under the MIT software license, see the accompanying
 # file COPYING or http://www.opensource.org/licenses/mit-license.php.
 
+if [ "$TRAVIS_OS_NAME" == "osx" ]; then
+    travis_retry brew install $BREW_PACKAGES

body: By accident. Fixed. This PR is still very rough; I can pick it up again now that #13728 is merged.
diff_hunk:
@@ -7,7 +7,7 @@
 export LC_ALL=C.UTF-8
 
 export HOST=x86_64-apple-darwin14
-export PACKAGES="cmake imagemagick libcap-dev librsvg2-bin libz-dev libbz2-dev libtiff-tools python3-dev python3-setuptools"
+export BREW_PACKAGES="automake berkeley-db4 libtool boost miniupnpc openssl pkg-config protobuf qt qrencode librsvg pyenv"

body: should move this below the LC_ALL line
diff_hunk:
@@ -4,6 +4,11 @@
 # Distributed under the MIT software license, see the accompanying
 # file COPYING or http://www.opensource.org/licenses/mit-license.php.
 
+if [ "$TRAVIS_OS_NAME" == "osx" ]; then
+    ${CI_RETRY_EXE} brew install $BREW_PACKAGES
+    return 0
+ fi
+

```suggestion
      # https://docs.travis-ci.com/user/reference/osx/#macos-version
```

This config doesn't boot (even after waiting an hour)

Maybe you need to install python via `brew upgrade python`?

```
Warning: automake 1.16.1_1 is already installed and up-to-date

To reinstall 1.16.1_1, run `brew reinstall automake`

To reinstall 4.8.30, run `brew reinstall berkeley-db@4`

To reinstall 2.4.6_1, run `brew reinstall libtool`

To reinstall 1.71.0, run `brew reinstall boost`

To reinstall 2.1, run `brew reinstall miniupnpc`

To reinstall 1.0.2t, run `brew reinstall openssl`

To reinstall 4.0.2, run `brew reinstall qrencode`

To upgrade to 3.10.0, run `brew upgrade protobuf`.

The command "brew install automake berkeley-db4 libtool boost miniupnpc openssl pkg-config protobuf qt qrencode librsvg pyenv" failed. Retrying, 3 of 3.

body:
Oh boy, Homebrew is a pain. I lifted some stuff from:
https://discourse.brew.sh/t/best-practice-for-homebrew-on-travis-brew-update-is-5min-to-build-time/5215/11 and https://github.com/vadi2/Mudlet/blob/857d1ae29fe6e55f1507399200c45db318b28ae6/CI/travis.osx.install.sh#L11-L35
